intro: Ruellia reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and its flowers are tubular with five lobes, usually in shades of blue or purple. Ruellia reflexa is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and ease of care.
